sourcesContent:
export const list = [

    {
        image: "/images/rowling.jpg",
        country: "UNITED KINGDOM",
        author: "J.K. Rowling",
        sold: "600+ million copies (Harry Potter series)",
        content: "Wrote much of the first Harry Potter book in cafés because she couldn’t afford heating at home. She was rejected by 12 publishers before Bloomsbury finally accepted the manuscript. She became the first billionaire author in history, though she has since donated much of her wealth."
    },

    {
        image: "/images/murakami.jpg",
        country: "JAPAN",
        author: "Haruki Murakami",
             sold: "30+ million copies worldwide",
        content: "Decided to become a writer suddenly while watching a baseball game in 1978—he describes it as a moment of revelation. Is an avid marathon runner and triathlete, and often compares writing novels to long-distance running. Collects vinyl records and once ran a jazz club before becoming a full-time author."
    },

    {
        image: "/images/ernest.jpeg",
           country: "USA",
        author: "Ernest Hemingway",
        sold: "Around 40 million copies",
        content: "Loved cats—he had a house full of six-toed cats in Key West, and their descendants still live there today."
    },

    {
        image: "/images/angelou.jpg",
           country: "JAPAN",
        author: "Maya Angelou",
        sold: "600 million copies for the Harry Potter",
        content: "Rented hotel rooms by the month just to write in peace—she removed all decorations to focus. Was also a singer, dancer, actress, and civil rights activist before becoming famous as an author. Her autobiography I Know Why the Caged Bird Sings was one of the first widely read books to openly discuss racism and trauma."
    },

    {
        image: "/images/twain.jpg",
           country: "JAPAN",
        author: "Mark Twein",
        sold: "600 million copies for the Harry Potter",
        content: "Published all her novels anonymously during her lifetime—her books were simply credited to “A Lady”. Was an avid letter writer, and her witty, lively correspondence is as famous as her novels. Despite her fame today, she earned only a modest income from her books during her life."
    },

    {
        image: "/images/kafka.jpg",
           country: "JAPAN",
        author: "Franz Kafka",
        sold: "600 million copies for the Harry Potter",
        content: "Worked as an insurance clerk by day and wrote his surreal fiction at night. Asked for all his unpublished manuscripts to be burned after his death—fortunately, his friend Max Brod ignored him, preserving classics like The Trial. Was extremely shy and rarely read his work aloud in public."
    },


    {
        image: "/images/agatha.jpg",
           country: "JAPAN",
        author: "Agatha Christie",
        sold: "600 million copies for the Harry Potter",
        content: "Agatha Christie worked in a pharmacy during World War I. This gave her deep knowledge of medicines and toxins, which she used to create realistic (and very clever) poison-related plots in her mysteries. In 1926, Christie herself mysteriously disappeared for 11 days, sparking a nationwide search. To this day, the full truth behind her disappearance is unknown."
    },


]
